ground_truth: Lizzie and the Gardiners are traveling through the rolling hills of the Peaks. Darcy is practicing his fencing. They shake hands and Baines leaves. Lizzie is picking her way across the rocks at the top of a hill, while the Gardiners are watching her from the bottom of the slope. Lizzie gazes at the countryside around her. That evening, the three of them are eating supper. Mrs. Gardiner looks at Lizzie, and Lizzie smiles. The next day, the open-topped carriage is making its way through the green countryside, towards Pemberley. It crosses a tiny, single-arched bridge over a stream. Lizzie and Mrs. Gardiner sit facing Mr. Gardiner. The carriage continues on its way, passing through woods in the bright sunshine. Then, the magnificent Pemberley appears, and Lizzie's breath is taken away by the sheer splendor of the classical, stately home. Lizzie nods with a broad smile. The carriage rolls beneath a grand, ornate arch leading to Pemberley. Inside, the housekeeper shows them a beautiful mahogany writing desk. They continue on, into the next room. The housekeeper turns to Lizzie, who walks over to the window and looks out at the lake, mirror-like, at the foot of the lawn. A portrait of Georgiana is seated and looking pensive, and there is a miniature portrait of a rather haughty young man. They head up a grand, white staircase. Outside, a white horse is cantering along a wooden path, with Darcy astride it, dressed elegantly in a top hat and frock coat. Bringing the horse to a halt, he stares from the hilltop, over at Pemberley, which can just be glimpsed through the trees. He breathes deeply, as if trying to come to a decision. Then suddenly, he sets the horse in motion again and gallops onward. Near a lake, he stops and quickly dismounts. He takes off his top hat and starts to undo his coat. Inside, the tour of Pemberley continues, and the housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall, lined with paintings on one side and windows on the other. She stops in front of one of the paintings, and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy, staring proudly out at them. Outside, Darcy has now taken off his frock coat, lays it on the grass, sits on it, and undoes his cravat. His dark hair curls with sweat. Then he unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off. Inside, Lizzie is still gazing up at his portrait. Darcy stands at the very edge of the lake, now in just his breeches and loose, white shirt. Steeling himself, he dives in, plunges down into the murky, green waters, then begins to swim with long, effortless strokes. Lizzie is now admiring the formal gardens.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Lizzie, along with the Gardiners, is embarking on a journey through the picturesque and undulating hills of the Peaks. Meanwhile, Darcy is diligently honing his skills in the art of fencing. After a brief exchange, they shake hands, and Baines departs. Lizzie carefully navigates her way across the rugged rocks perched atop a hill, while the Gardiners observe her from their vantage point at the bottom of the slope. Lizzie takes a moment to admire the vast and beautiful countryside that surrounds her. As evening descends, the trio gathers to enjoy a meal together. Mrs. Gardiner glances at Lizzie, who responds with a warm and genuine smile. 

The following day, the open-topped carriage is seen making its leisurely journey through the lush, green countryside, heading towards the grand estate of Pemberley. The carriage gracefully crosses a tiny, single-arched bridge that spans a gently flowing stream. Inside the carriage, Lizzie and Mrs. Gardiner are seated facing Mr. Gardiner. The carriage continues its journey, passing through dense woods bathed in bright, cheerful sunshine. Eventually, the magnificent and awe-inspiring Pemberley comes into view, and Lizzie is utterly captivated by the sheer grandeur and classical elegance of the stately home. With a broad smile, she nods in appreciation. The carriage rolls forward, passing beneath a grand and ornate archway that leads to Pemberley. 

Once inside, the housekeeper graciously shows them a beautiful mahogany writing desk, a testament to the home's refined taste. They proceed into the next room, where the housekeeper turns her attention to Lizzie, who walks over to the window. She gazes out at the lake, which lies at the foot of the lawn, its surface as smooth and reflective as a mirror. Nearby, a portrait of Georgiana is displayed, capturing her in a seated, contemplative pose, alongside a miniature portrait of a rather haughty young man. The group ascends a grand, white staircase, adding to the sense of opulence. 

Outside, a white horse is seen cantering along a wooden path, with Darcy elegantly astride it, dressed impeccably in a top hat and frock coat. Bringing the horse to a halt, he gazes from the hilltop, casting his eyes over Pemberley, which is just visible through the trees. He takes a deep breath, as if contemplating an important decision. Suddenly, he urges the horse forward again, galloping onward with determination. Near a tranquil lake, he stops and swiftly dismounts. Removing his top hat, he begins to undo his coat. 

Inside, the tour of Pemberley continues, and the housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall, lined with an impressive array of paintings on one side and large windows on the other. She pauses in front of one of the paintings, and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy, who stares proudly out at them. Outside, Darcy has now removed his frock coat, laying it carefully on the grass, and sits on it as he undoes his cravat. His dark hair curls with sweat from the exertion. He then unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off. Inside, Lizzie remains captivated by his portrait. 

Darcy stands at the very edge of the lake, now dressed only in his breeches and a loose, white shirt. Gathering his resolve, he dives in, plunging into the murky, green waters, and begins to swim with long, effortless strokes. Meanwhile, Lizzie is now admiring the meticulously maintained formal gardens, taking in their beauty and symmetry.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Lizzie, accompanied by the Gardiners, is embarking on an exciting and enchanting journey through the picturesque and undulating hills of the mesmerizing Peaks. Meanwhile, elsewhere, Darcy is diligently honing his skills and perfecting his technique in the refined art of fencing. After a concise yet meaningful exchange of words, they shake hands in a gesture of parting, and Baines departs from the scene. Lizzie carefully and thoughtfully navigates her way across the rugged rocks that are precariously perched atop a hill, while the Gardiners stand watching her with interest from their vantage point at the bottom of the gently sloping incline. Lizzie takes a moment to pause and admire the vast and breathtakingly beautiful countryside that completely surrounds her. As the sun sets and evening descends upon them, the trio gathers to enjoy a delightful and satisfying meal together. Mrs. Gardiner casts a fond glance at Lizzie, who responds with a warm and genuine smile.

The following day brings a fresh adventure as the open-topped carriage is seen making its leisurely and scenic journey through the lush, green, and idyllic countryside, heading towards the grand and impressive estate of Pemberley. The carriage gracefully and smoothly crosses a tiny, single-arched bridge that spans a gently flowing stream, creating a picturesque scene. Inside the comfortable carriage, Lizzie and Mrs. Gardiner are seated facing Mr. Gardiner, engaging in pleasant conversation. The carriage continues its serene journey, passing through dense and vibrant woods bathed in bright, cheerful sunshine. Eventually, the magnificent and awe-inspiring Pemberley comes into view, and Lizzie is utterly captivated by the sheer grandeur and classical elegance of the stately home. With a broad, appreciative smile, she nods in acknowledgment and admiration. The carriage rolls ahead, passing beneath a grand and ornate archway that majestically leads to the entrance of Pemberley.

Once inside the grand abode, the housekeeper graciously shows them a beautiful and exquisite mahogany writing desk, which stands as a testament to the refined taste and elegance of the home. They proceed into the next elegantly furnished room, where the housekeeper turns her attention to Lizzie, who walks over to the large window. She gazes out at the picturesque lake, which lies at the foot of the lush lawn, its surface smooth and reflective like a perfect mirror. Nearby, a striking portrait of Georgiana is displayed, capturing her in a seated, contemplative pose, alongside a small, detailed miniature portrait of a rather haughty-looking young man. The group then ascends a grand, white staircase, which further adds to the sense of opulence and splendor.

Outside, a graceful white horse is seen cantering along a charming wooden path, with Darcy elegantly astride it, impeccably dressed in a stylish top hat and frock coat. Bringing the horse to a gentle halt, he gazes with contemplation from the hilltop, casting his eyes over Pemberley, which is just visible through the dense trees. He takes a deep and thoughtful breath, as if contemplating an important decision lying ahead. Suddenly, with newfound determination, he urges the horse forward again, galloping onward with purpose. Near a tranquil and serene lake, he stops and swiftly dismounts, removing his top hat, and begins to undo his coat.

Inside the grand estate, the tour of Pemberley continues, and the attentive housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall, lined with an impressive array of beautifully framed paintings on one side and large, sunshine-filled windows on the other. She pauses in front of one particular painting, and Lizzie gazes up with interest at the portrait of Darcy, who stares proudly and confidently out at them. Outside, Darcy has now removed his frock coat, laying it carefully on the grassy ground, and sits on it as he methodically undoes his cravat. His dark hair curls with the sheen of sweat from the physical exertion. He then unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off, leaving it aside. Inside the hall, Lizzie remains captivated by his striking portrait.

Darcy stands at the very edge of the tranquil lake, now dressed only in his breeches and a loose, flowing white shirt. Gathering his resolve and courage, he dives gracefully in, plunging into the murky, green waters, and begins to swim with long, effortless strokes that reflect his strength and grace. Meanwhile, Lizzie is now outside, admiring the meticulously maintained formal gardens, taking in their beauty, symmetry, and elegance with a sense of awe and appreciation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Lizzie and the Gardiners embark on a journey through the undulating landscape of the Peaks, their carriage gently swaying with the motion of the rolling hills. Meanwhile, Darcy is engaged in the precise and disciplined practice of fencing, his movements sharp and focused. After completing his session, he and Baines exchange a firm handshake, signaling the end of their interaction, and Baines departs. High atop a hill, Lizzie carefully navigates her way across the uneven rocks, her steps deliberate and cautious, while the Gardiners observe her progress from the base of the slope, their eyes following her every move. Lizzie pauses to take in the vast expanse of the countryside, her gaze sweeping across the serene landscape. As evening descends, the trio gathers around a table for supper, the warm glow of the setting sun casting a gentle light over them. Mrs. Gardiner glances at Lizzie, who responds with a soft, knowing smile. The following day, they find themselves in an open-topped carriage, which leisurely makes its way through the lush, green countryside, heading towards the grand estate of Pemberley. The carriage crosses a quaint, single-arched bridge that spans a gently flowing stream, the sound of water adding to the tranquil ambiance. Lizzie and Mrs. Gardiner sit opposite Mr. Gardiner, the three of them enjoying the scenic journey. As the carriage continues, it passes through sun-dappled woods, the bright sunshine filtering through the leaves. Suddenly, the majestic sight of Pemberley comes into view, its classical architecture and stately presence leaving Lizzie momentarily breathless with awe. She nods, her face breaking into a broad smile, as the carriage rolls beneath a grand, ornate arch that marks the entrance to Pemberley. Inside the estate, the housekeeper guides them through the opulent rooms, pausing to show them a beautiful mahogany writing desk, its polished surface gleaming in the light. They move on to the next room, where the housekeeper turns her attention to Lizzie, who walks over to a window. She gazes out at the lake below, its surface smooth and mirror-like, nestled at the foot of the manicured lawn. Her eyes then drift to a portrait of Georgiana, seated and looking pensive, and a miniature portrait of a rather haughty young man. The group ascends a grand, white staircase, the elegance of the surroundings enveloping them. Outside, a white horse canters along a wooden path, Darcy astride it, dressed impeccably in a top hat and frock coat. He brings the horse to a halt at the hilltop, his eyes fixed on Pemberley, which is partially visible through the trees. He takes a deep breath, as if contemplating a significant decision, before suddenly urging the horse forward once more, galloping with renewed purpose. Near a lake, he stops and swiftly dismounts, removing his top hat and beginning to undo his coat. Inside, the tour of Pemberley continues, with the housekeeper leading them into a magnificent long hall, one side adorned with paintings and the other lined with windows. She halts in front of a particular painting, and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy, his image exuding pride and confidence. Outside, Darcy has shed his frock coat, laying it carefully on the grass before sitting on it and undoing his cravat. His dark hair curls with the moisture of sweat. He then unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off, leaving him in just his breeches and a loose, white shirt. Standing at the very edge of the lake, he steels himself before diving in, plunging into the murky, green waters, and swimming with long, effortless strokes. Inside, Lizzie continues to admire the formal gardens, her appreciation for the beauty around her growing with each passing moment.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Lizzie and the Gardiners are traveling through the rolling hills of the Peaks, a region known for its breathtaking landscapes and as a favored retreat during the Regency era. Meanwhile, Darcy is practicing his fencing, a popular sport among the English aristocracy that reflects both his skill and status. They shake hands, a formal gesture, and Baines leaves after completing his duties, perhaps as a steward or servant. Lizzie is picking her way across the rocks at the top of a hill, enjoying the panoramic views, while the Gardiners are watching her from the bottom of the slope, appreciating her adventurous spirit. Lizzie gazes at the countryside around her, with its expanse of green pastures and dotted stone cottages. That evening, the three of them are eating supper, likely a meal consisting of period-appropriate dishes such as roasts and puddings. Mrs. Gardiner looks at Lizzie, and Lizzie smiles, sharing an unspoken understanding. The next day, the open-topped carriage, typical of the era and perfect for enjoying the fresh air and scenery, is making its way through the green countryside, towards Pemberley, the grand estate owned by Mr. Darcy. It crosses a tiny, single-arched bridge over a stream, reminiscent of the quaint architecture of the time. Lizzie and Mrs. Gardiner sit facing Mr. Gardiner, enjoying the tranquil setting. The carriage continues on its way, passing through woods in the bright sunshine, where the dappled light plays on the carriage's polished surfaces. Then, the magnificent Pemberley, famous for its classical architecture and sprawling grounds, appears, and Lizzie's breath is taken away by the sheer splendor of the classical, stately home that reflects the grandeur of the English gentry. Lizzie nods with a broad smile, overwhelmed by its beauty. The carriage rolls beneath a grand, ornate arch leading to Pemberley, an entrance designed to impress visitors. Inside, the housekeeper, a key figure in maintaining the estate's smooth operation, shows them a beautiful mahogany writing desk, crafted by skilled artisans of the period. They continue on, into the next room. The housekeeper turns to Lizzie, who walks over to the window and looks out at the lake, mirror-like, at the foot of the lawn, a feature often included in the landscaping of grand estates to reflect the sky. A portrait of Georgiana, Darcyâ€™s sister, is seated and looking pensive, capturing her gentle and introspective nature, and there is a miniature portrait of a rather haughty young man, perhaps representing Darcy in his youth. They head up a grand, white staircase, a hallmark of opulence in such homes. Outside, a white horse is cantering along a wooden path, with Darcy astride it, dressed elegantly in a top hat and frock coat, attire befitting his status as a gentleman. Bringing the horse to a halt, he stares from the hilltop, over at Pemberley, which can just be glimpsed through the trees, contemplating his life and decisions. He breathes deeply, as if trying to come to a decision about something significant. Then suddenly, he sets the horse in motion again and gallops onward. Near a lake, he stops and quickly dismounts, eager to feel the refreshing water. He takes off his top hat and starts to undo his coat, seeking relief from the warming day. Inside, the tour of Pemberley continues, and the housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall, lined with paintings on one side and windows on the other, displaying the family's wealth and heritage. She stops in front of one of the paintings, and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy, staring proudly out at them, evoking the strength and pride of the Darcy lineage. Outside, Darcy has now taken off his frock coat, lays it on the grass, sits on it, and undoes his cravat, enjoying a moment of solitude. His dark hair curls with sweat, showing the exertion from his ride. Then he unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off, embracing the simplicity of the moment. Inside, Lizzie is still gazing up at his portrait, perhaps contemplating the man behind the proud exterior. Darcy stands at the very edge of the lake, now in just his breeches and loose, white shirt, feeling the cool breeze against his skin. Steeling himself, he dives in, plunges down into the murky, green waters, then begins to swim with long, effortless strokes, relishing the freedom the water provides. Lizzie is now admiring the formal gardens, meticulously planned and maintained, showcasing a variety of flowers and carefully trimmed hedges.

Inside the tour of Pemberley continues and the housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall lined with paintings on one side and windows on the other. She stops in front of one of the paintings and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy staring proudly out at them. Outside Darcy has now taken off his frock coat lays it on the grass sits on it and undoes his cravat. His dark hair curls with sweat. Then he unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off. Inside Lizzie is still gazing up at his portrait. Darcy stands at the very edge of the lake now in just his breeches and loose white shirt. Steeling himself he dives in plunges down into the murky green waters then begins to swim with long effortless strokes. Lizzie is now admiring the formal gardens.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Lizzie and the Gardiners are traveling through the rolling hills of the Peaks. Darcy is practicing his fencing. They shake hands and Baines leaves. Lizzie is picking her way across the rocks at the top of a hill while the Gardiners are watching her from the bottom of the slope. Lizzie gazes at the countryside around her. That evening the three of them are eating supper. Mrs Gardiner looks at Lizzie and Lizzie smiles. The next day the opentopped carriage is making its way through the green countryside towards Pemberley. It crosses a tiny singlearched bridge over a stream. Lizzie and Mrs Gardiner sit facing Mr Gardiner. The carriage continues on its way passing through woods in the bright sunshine. Then the magnificent Pemberley appears and Lizzie's breath is taken away by the sheer splendor of the classical stately home. Lizzie nods with a broad smile. The carriage rolls beneath a grand ornate arch leading to Pemberley. Inside the housekeeper shows them a beautiful mahogany writing desk. They continue on into the next room. The housekeeper turns to Lizzie who walks over to the window and looks out at the lake mirrorlike at the foot of the lawn. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. A portrait of Georgiana is seated and looking pensive and there is a miniature portrait of a rather haughty young man. They head up a grand white staircase. Outside a white horse is cantering along a wooden path with Darcy astride it dressed elegantly in a top hat and frock coat. Bringing the horse to a halt he stares from the hilltop over at Pemberley which can just be glimpsed through the trees. He breathes deeply as if trying to come to a decision. Then suddenly he sets the horse in motion again and gallops onward. Near a lake he stops and quickly dismounts. He takes off his top hat and starts to undo his coat. Inside the tour of Pemberley continues and the housekeeper leads them into a magnificent long hall lined with paintings on one side and windows on the other. She stops in front of one of the paintings and Lizzie gazes up at the portrait of Darcy staring proudly out at them. Outside Darcy has now taken off his frock coat lays it on the grass sits on it and undoes his cravat. His dark hair curls with sweat. Then he unbuttons his waistcoat and slips it off. Inside Lizzie is still gazing up at his portrait. Darcy stands at the very edge of the lake now in just his breeches and loose white shirt. Steeling himself he dives in plunges down into the murky green waters then begins to swim with long effortless strokes. Lizzie is now admiring the formal gardens.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Nina and the Sailmakers are navigating through the bustling streets of the Cityscape. Riley is perfecting his juggling. They bow heads and Fenton departs. Nina is skipping her way across the sand at the edge of a beach, while the Sailmakers are observing her from the top of the dune. Nina squints at the skyline around her. That night, the trio is feasting on pastries. Mr. Sailmaker glances at Nina, and Nina laughs. The following morning, the horse-drawn wagon is winding its path through the arid desert, towards Hallington Estate. It traverses a grand, multi-laned highway over a ravine. Nina and Mr. Sailmaker sit back-to-back with Mrs. Sailmaker. The wagon continues on its journey, moving through canyons in the soft moonlight. Then, the majestic Hallington Estate emerges, and Nina's heart races with excitement at the sight of the ornate, rustic manor. Nina blinks with wide eyes. The wagon tumbles beneath a towering, ancient oak leading to Hallington Estate. Inside, the caretaker presents them with an exquisite marble chess set. They move onward, into the adjacent chamber. The caretaker gestures to Nina, who strides over to the mirror and peeks at the fountain, glistening, at the base of the terrace. A mural of Isabelle is reclining and appearing thoughtful, and there's a miniature sketch of a stern elder gentleman. They climb a narrow, wrought iron staircase. Outdoors, a black stallion is trotting along a cobblestone road, with Riley seated upon it, draped casually in a bowler hat and leather vest. Bringing the stallion to a standstill, he gazes from the rooftop, over at Hallington Estate, which can just be peered at through the buildings. He sighs heavily, as if pondering a choice. Then abruptly, he sends the stallion trotting anew and charges ahead. Beside a fountain, he halts and swiftly mounts off. He removes his bowler hat and begins to loosen his vest. Indoors, the exploration of Hallington Estate persists, and the caretaker escorts them into a lavish circular chamber, adorned with sculptures on one wall and drapes on the other. She pauses in front of one of the sculptures, and Nina peers up at the bust of Riley, gazing stoically out at them. Outside, Riley has now stripped off his leather vest, places it under a tree, reclines against it, and unknots his scarf. His blond hair falls softly in the breeze. Then he opens his satchel and pulls it away. Inside, Nina is still peering up at his sculpture. Riley stands at the very brink of the fountain, now in just his trousers and billowing, blue shirt. Gathering courage, he leaps in, plunging deep into the bubbling, clear water, then begins to paddle with short, graceful strokes. Nina is now marveling at the wild flora.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Lizzie and the Gardiners travel through the Peaks, while Darcy practices fencing. As Lizzie explores the hilltops, the Gardiners observe her. They later dine together. The next day, their carriage moves through the countryside towards Pemberley, crossing a small bridge and passing through woods. Lizzie is awed by Pemberleyâ€™s grandeur upon arrival. Inside, the housekeeper shows them a mahogany desk and they view portraits, including one of a pensive Georgiana and a haughty young man. Meanwhile, Darcy rides a horse near Pemberley and reflects deeply. He dismounts near a lake, removes his coat and cravat, and dives into the water. Inside, Lizzie continues the tour, intrigued by paintings, especially one of Darcy. She then admires the formal gardens as Darcy swims with ease in the lake.
